intro: Vahlodea paramushirensis, commonly known as the Paramushire lily, is a rare flowering plant native to the Russian Far East. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, forested areas and has strap-like, grassy leaves. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
